google_reviews.author: Leo Spencer
google_reviews.review:
The management is wonderful.  When a pipe burst and two buildings were left without water for about a day, they quickly delivered gallons of water to each apartment and set up plenty of outhouses.  They also kept us updated via email throughout the whole day.  Plus, they gave everyone pizza gift cards.  Super thoughtful and professional.

The apartments themselves are in good condition and the maintenance guy is quick and friendly.  Rent isn't too bad, either.

New England Apartments is definitely a  good housing option in Bellingham.  10/10 would recommend.

google_reviews.author: Kate Welch
google_reviews.review:
I lived in the New England Apartments for 2 years while I was a student, and while overall it was a decent experience, there are some definite pros and cons.
The apartments themselves are nice enough, clean and spacious. But they're built pretty cheaply so things tend to need lots of repairs or just don't work quite right. I'm talking doors that were shady at best, locks that were installed incorrectly, windows that got stuck and toilets that leaked. They were pretty good about doing repairs quickly and were always very polite about letting you know when they'd be doing complex wide repairs, such as painting or checking on carbon monoxide alarms.

The staff is very friendly and helpful... but only for a few hours a day. RPM has extremely limited and unhelpfully short office hours, and they aren't the best about answering the phone during those office hours (which were reduced to around 4 hours a day recently), and the emergency off-hours phone number doesn't always work, and sometimes just rings their regular voicemail, which is highly unhelpful.

The pricing on these apartments is a bit much for what you're getting, but it's not a bad place to live and they're close to campus.

google_reviews.author: Marie Sullivan
google_reviews.review: Ive lived in the New England Apartments for almost a year now. Weve had a lot of things that needed to be fixed, (sink replacement, refrigerator replacement, etc), but it was always done in a timely manner and the maintenance guy is so so friendly and pleasant. Theyre very good at responding to emails and concerns during the hours they are available, but those hours are quite limited. As far as I know its the only apartment complex they manage, so everything is very personal and I feel like they truly care about their tenants. The walls are thin, but not too thin, just hope you dont have noisy neighbors. I always feel safe in these apartments (we even fell asleep with the door unlocked by accident and nothing happened), and during winter break there was a package outside one of the doors that wasnt touched by ANYONE for nearly a month. I can walk to and from school in roughly 20 minutes. All around good apartments, only real complaints is that its pretty pricey for college students but its in a very convenient location, and parking can be pretty annoying (spots are small and people park like idiots sometimes) but there is a lot of street parking available. I plan to live here for the rest of my college career at Western.

summary.text:
Good

New England Apartments offers many positive aspects according to user reviews. Residents have praised the management team and maintenance staff for their friendliness and prompt service. Several users mentioned that maintenance requests, such as sink or refrigerator replacements, were handled efficiently. The apartments themselves are described as clean and reasonably spacious. Despite minor issues in construction quality, management is recognized for their efforts to improve the living experience by coordinating repairs and maintaining clear communication during maintenance activities.

Renters also find the apartment location convenient, especially for students, as it is within walking distance from the local college campus. Safety within the community appears to be a non-issue, with one resident noting that even when doors were accidentally left unlocked, there were no security concerns. While parking can sometimes be tricky, as spots are tight, ample street parking is often available. Overall, the property is considered a comfortable option for those in the Bellingham area, with most residents feeling well taken care of.

Great

A standout example of the exceptional service at New England Apartments involved a burst pipe situation, where management rose to the occasion impressively. When water service was disrupted, management swiftly provided gallons of water to affected apartments and set up temporary restroom facilities, ensuring tenant comfort. This prompt crisis management, paired with open communication via email and gestures like issuing pizza gift cards, was appreciated by residents and showcased the team's dedication to providing a great living environment.

Residents often highlight the personal care and attention received here, noting that the management team's approach feels more personalized than larger complexes. Despite limited office hours, when reachable, the staff is responsive and effectively manages concerns through email communications. The overall sense of community fostered by such attentive management contributes significantly to the highly positive experiences of many tenants, as highlighted in their upper-tier ratings. These efforts reflect a commitment to creating a welcoming and responsive residential community.

Bad

While there are notable positives, New England Apartments is not without its challenges, as mentioned in user reviews. A common issue is the limited office hours, which some residents find inconvenient. This includes being unable to always get through to someone during designated times, which can be frustrating in urgent situations. The emergency contact number being ineffective at times further complicates communication, leaving tenants feeling unsupported outside regular hours.

Another concern relates to the construction quality of the apartments, which some residents feel could be better. Issues such as stuck windows, improperly installed locks, and leaky toilets are mentioned as recurring nuisances. Although the maintenance team is responsive, frequent repairs can be disruptive. Rent prices, despite these issues, are considered a bit high for the value received, causing residents to question the overall cost-effectiveness of staying in the complex.

Ugly

In the rare instances of serious dissatisfaction, some residents have rated their experience poorly, reflecting significant disconnects in expectations. A rating of one star with no accompanying review suggests deep frustrations that resonate negatively without detailed context. This highlights the disparity between positive experiences and negative perceptions that can greatly vary from tenant to tenant. Additionally, the absence of owner responses to any review indicates a lack of public engagement from management, which could help bridge understanding and address grievances more formally.
